ud2.8:1.3: Mūḷha here has the sense of “gone astray” in reference to obstructed labor that prevents birth; see MN 86:14.2.
ud2.8:15.4: Lohitakumbhiya is probably a play on the common phrase lohakumbhiya, “copper pot”, which is commonly used in descriptions of hell. The boy, it seems, had an unusually rapid linguistic development.
